summary: Internal email chain from November 29, 2021, regarding urgent updates to victim notification information for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The correspondence highlights outdated public information about trial access and requests updates to clarify that proceedings are in-person, not via dial-in.

persons.name: Ed Friedland
persons.context: Makes a request to update victim notification information regarding the Maxwell trial, indicating outdated dial-in info is causing public confusion.

persons.name: Jeffrey Liao
persons.context: Identified as the person who can add updated victim information to the Maxwell victim page on the Department of Justice website.

connections.description: Friedland's request for updated victim information is to be implemented by Liao on the DOJ website.

events.title: Urgent Update to Maxwell Victim Notice
events.description: Internal email chain reveals an urgent need to update public-facing information for victims regarding the Ghislaine Maxwell trial, correcting outdated dial-in access information.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Outdated information on the DOJ website was causing the public to incorrectly attempt phone access to the Ghislaine Maxwell trial proceedings.
The latest court order specified that the Maxwell trial was to be attended in-person, not via dial-in.
An urgent update was requested for the Maxwell victim notification page to clarify the correct access method.
